data.title: Sunday Brunch delight
data.text: I believe this restaurant recently located to its current location a couple buildings south of the original.  The decor and atmosphere are really awesome, and it's ground floor with easy access from the street.  Super friendly owners and serving staff.  The brunch buffet was enormous and fresh and everything we had was delicious.  Nice selection of desserts also.  This was our first time here and it will not be our last time when we're looking for weekday lunch or Sunday brunch.  Perfection.

data.title: Good food, great desserts, amazing people!
data.text: Huge selection of food setup buffet style.  Everything from a pasta bar with amazing sauces to soups and salads.  Food is great... save room for dessert because the cakes are amazing!!

data.title: Old world Charm
data.text:
What a wonderful experience, five of us enjoyed the buffet lunch.  One of our group was a student home for the holidays and could not stop telling us how much she enjoyed the chicken pot pie.  Sadly I had already eaten my fill of BBQ'd ribs and mashed potatoes, not to mention the strawberry cake that was available for desert.  Not one of us had the same food, the lunch was buffet style and exceptional.  

Older building with a classy atmosphere that is sadly to be converted to apartments in the near future.  We were told the restaurant will continue in business and will be moving just one building away.  Thank goodness because the strawberry cake was superb!

data.title: Great Food in an elegant heritage Wichita nuilding
data.text: We enjoyed Caesars Table recently with friends. The food was excellent! Since this was a group event, dinner was served buffet style. The food was all prepared in house. I particularly enjoyed their fried chicken and mashed potatoes, but everythig was great, right down to the decadent chocolate pie I had for dessert. The restaurant hours are a bit out of the ordinary so check them out online to plan your visit.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Though a bit hard to find, it's a great place for lunch in downtown Wichita.  Good home cooking and wonderful pies.

data.title: Great Food!!
data.text: If you are downtown and need quick friendly service, along with homestyle food, this is your place.  You get many food choices on the buffet, plus soup, salad and a pasta bar, plus amazing desserts for $10.95!  You will not be disappointed by their food, which is all homemade. The soup and rolls are my favorite!!

data.title: Prom Dinner evening of  3/28...subway would have been a fresher choice
data.text: Joined friends for North West Prom dinner. This was a catered meal rather then one that would be served daily at the restaurant (I assume). Food tasted made ahead, like prefab frozen food. It was edible, but nothing to brag about.

data.title: Unbeatabke
data.text:
I have eaten here several times and I can unequivocally say that no other restaurant in Wichita can match this facility.  They are located on the mezzanine level in Market Centre, 155 N. Market, formerly The Lassen Hotel. 

I highly recommend it.  Best food in downtown Wichita

data.title: Wonderful option for Weekday Lunch!
data.text: This lunch-only restaurant has only been open for about a month, but I've visited it twice and have been very pleased with the food.  The full buffet for $10.95 includes your drink (tea or lemonade), soup, salad, many entrees and sides, and choice of 3 different desserts.  You won't leave this place hungry!  The entrees when I visited included lasagna, fried chicken, BBQ pork ribs, sliced brisket, coconut catfish, grilled chicken breast, Chicken Lombardi (wonderful chicken covered with mushrooms and cheese).  The sides included real mashed potatoes with gravy, buttered corn, green beans with onions & bacon, rolls & butter.  There are also four or five sandwich items on the menu if you don't feel like having a buffet, salad bar or soup.  One of our party tried the BBQ pulled pork sandwich and it was huge!  Chips come with the sandwiches but you can pay an extra $1 for pasta salad, potato salad, French fries, onion rings or a small salad.  We tried the French fries which were fresh cut and were very good.  The owner (Sam) came to our table during both visits to check on how we were doing.

data.title: Very great value for your money
data.text: The best value for the amount you pay. Everything is made fresh daily. Very quiet place but great decor. The waiter Jim was the best

data.title: A great relaxing restaurant.
data.text: This use to be located on west Kellogg for many years.  When the owner was able to relocate,  he moved to the present location.  The restaurant serves a buffet between the hours of eleven to two,  but also serves soup, sandwiches, and salad.  The buffet cost $ 10.95 per person,  which includes lemonade or tea and homemade pie or cake (my two favorite are the Butterfinger cake and the coconut cream pie).  The buffet consist of a variety of different meats and vegetables and the menu changes daily.  The food is also freshly made.  If you want a pop to drink, they have those also.  I especially like that the owner comes around to talk with you, and really cared that you were enjoying your meal.  Our server, Jim kept our drinks filled, and our plates were cleared as soon as our plate was empty.  If you are looking for a place that is quiet for a business meeting,  or a sit down place for your family,  I highly recommend it.  You won't leave hungry.
